TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit QuicStream extends System.IO.Stream
Public NotInheritable Class QuicStream Inherits Stream
public ref class QuicStream sealed : System::IO::Stream

Docs.summary: Represents a QUIC stream. can be unidirectional, that is, write-only for the opening side, or bidirectional, which allows both sides to write.
Docs.remarks:
can be used in a same way as any other .
Apart from a stream API, also exposes QUIC-specific features:
Closes the writing side of the stream as a single operation with the write itself.
Closes the writing side of the stream.
Aborts either the writing or the reading side of the stream.
Returns a that will complete when the stream writing side has been closed (gracefully or abortively).
Returns a that will complete when the stream reading side has been closed (gracefully or abortively).

MemberSignature.Value: public void Abort (System.Net.Quic.QuicAbortDirection abortDirection, long errorCode);
.method public hidebysig instance void Abort(valuetype System.Net.Quic.QuicAbortDirection abortDirection, int64 errorCode) cil managed
Public Sub Abort (abortDirection As QuicAbortDirection, errorCode As Long)
member this.Abort : System.Net.Quic.QuicAbortDirection * int64 -> unit
public: void Abort(System::Net::Quic::QuicAbortDirection abortDirection, long errorCode);

Docs.param: The direction of the stream to abort.
The error code with which to abort the stream. This value is application-protocol (which is the layer above QUIC) dependent.
Docs.summary: Aborts either the reading, writing, or both sides of the stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Corresponds to [STOP_SENDING](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9000.html#frame-stop-sending) and [RESET_STREAM](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9000.html#frame-reset-stream) QUIC frames.

Public Overrides Function BeginRead (buffer As Byte(), offset As Integer, count As Integer, callback As AsyncCallback, state As Object) As IAsyncResult
override this.BeginRead : byte[] * int * int * AsyncCallback * obj -> IAsyncResult
public: override IAsyncResult ^ BeginRead(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ buffer, int offset, int count, AsyncCallback ^ callback, System::Object ^ state);

Docs.param: The buffer to read the data into.
The byte offset in at which to begin writing data read from the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the read is complete.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read request from other requests.
Docs.summary: Begins an asynchronous read operation. (Consider using instead.)
Docs.returns: An that represents the asynchronous read, which could still be pending.

Docs.summary: Begins an asynchronous write operation. (Consider using instead.)

Docs.summary: Gracefully completes the writing side of the stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Corresponds to an empty [STREAM](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9000.html#frame-stream) frame with `FIN` flag set to `true`.
Equivalent to using <xref:System.Net.Quic.QuicStream.WriteAsync(System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Byte},System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)> with `completeWrites: true`.

Docs.summary: To be added.

public: override System::Threading::Tasks::ValueTask DisposeAsync();

Docs.summary: If the read side is not fully consumed, that is, is not completed or hasn't returned 0, aborts the read side with provided . If the write side hasn't been closed, closes it gracefully as if was called. Finally, all resources associated with the stream will be released.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous dispose operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int EndRead (IAsyncResult asyncResult);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 EndRead(class System.IAsyncResult asyncResult) cil managed
Public Overrides Function EndRead (asyncResult As IAsyncResult) As Integer
override this.EndRead : IAsyncResult -> int
public: override int EndRead(IAsyncResult ^ asyncResult);

Docs.param: The reference to the pending asynchronous request to finish.
Docs.summary: Waits for the pending asynchronous read to complete. (Consider using instead.)
Docs.returns: The number of bytes read from the stream, between zero (0) and the number of bytes requested.
Docs.remarks: ReadAsync returns zero (0) only if zero bytes were requested or if no more bytes will be available because it's at the end of the stream; otherwise, read operations do not complete until at least one byte is available. If zero bytes are requested, read operations may complete immediately or may not complete until at least one byte is available (but without consuming any data).

Docs.param: A reference to the outstanding asynchronous I/O request.
Docs.summary: Ends an asynchronous write operation. (Consider using instead.)

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

Docs.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
Docs.summary: Asynchronously clears all buffers for this stream, causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device, and monitors cancellation requests.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous flush operation.
Docs.exception: The cancellation token was canceled. This exception is stored into the returned task.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int Read (Span<byte> buffer);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 Read(valuetype System.Span`1<unsigned int8> buffer) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Read (buffer As Span(Of Byte)) As Integer
override this.Read : Span<byte> -> int
public: override int Read(Span<System::Byte> buffer);

Docs.param: A region of memory. When this method returns, the contents of this region are replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
Docs.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the size of the buffer if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the buffer's length is zero or the end of the stream has been reached.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int Read (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 Read(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Read (buffer As Byte(), offset As Integer, count As Integer) As Integer
override this.Read : byte[] * int * int -> int
public: override int Read(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ buffer, int offset, int count);

Docs.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
Docs.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if is 0 or the end of the stream has been reached.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask<int> ReadAsync (Memory<byte> buffer, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask`1<int32> ReadAsync(valuetype System.Memory`1<unsigned int8> buffer, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Overrides Function ReadAsync (buffer As Memory(Of Byte), Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As ValueTask(Of Integer)
override this.ReadAsync : Memory<byte> * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask<int>

Docs.param: The region of memory to write the data into.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
Docs.summary: Asynchronously reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream, advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read, and monitors cancellation requests.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
Docs.remarks: The value of its property contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer. The result value can be less than the length of the buffer if that many bytes are not currently available, or it can be 0 (zero) if the length of the buffer is 0 or if the end of the stream has been reached.
Docs.exception: The cancellation token was canceled. This exception is stored into the returned task.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Threading.Tasks.Task<int> ReadAsync (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<int32> ReadAsync(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Overrides Function ReadAsync (buffer As Byte(), offset As Integer, count As Integer, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Integer)
override this.ReadAsync : byte[] * int * int * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<int>

Docs.param: The buffer to write the data into.
The byte offset in at which to begin writing data from the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
Docs.summary: Asynchronously reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream, advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read, and monitors cancellation requests.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
Docs.remarks: The value of the property contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer. The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if is 0 or if the end of the stream has been reached.
Docs.exception: The cancellation token was canceled. This exception is stored into the returned task.
